thread.title: Shore’s hat-trick gives Stars 5-2 win over IceHogs
thread.title_full: Shore’s hat-trick gives Stars 5-2 win over IceHogs

author: Staff
title: Shore’s hat-trick gives Stars 5-2 win over IceHogs
text:
Shore’s hat-trick gives Stars 5-2 win over IceHogs 10:30 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015 | Filed in: Sports ﻿ Story Highlights 
Texas’ Devin Shore scored his first career hat-trick as the Stars snapped an eleven game losing streak against Rockford with a 5-2 victory over the IceHogs Saturday night in Rockford, Illinois. 
Shore, a second round pick by the Dallas Stars in 2012, has six goals through three games this season. Texas has won three straight to open the season and has won its last two on the road. 
The IceHogs (1-2-0-0) took the lead with a power-play goal in the first period and the Stars responded with four straight scores to take a 4-1 lead in the third period. 
Shore tied it with a short-handed goal at the 10:57 mark in the first period. Less than a minute later, Shore gave Texas the lead when he got a loose puck from a tie-up on a face-off and slipped it past Rockford goalie Michael Leighton. 
Derek Hulak put Texas up by two in the second period and Shore completed the hat-trick at 7:26 in the third when he knocked in a one-timer. Rockford’s Tanner Kero cut the lead to two with less than ten minutes left, but Texas’ Brendan Ranford put Texas up by three with an empty-net goal in the closing minutes of the third.
